result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael David Skwortz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $500 cash bail applied. Court costs due during term of probation. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08

No contact with: RS or SS. Defendant to avoid the victim's residence and/or any location temporarily occupied by the victim. The defendant avoid contacting the victim or causing any person other than a party's attorney or law enforcement officer to contact the victim. Contact includes: contact at victim's home, work, school, public places, in person, by phone, in writing, by electronic communication or device, or in any other manner. Any counseling or treatment deemed appropriate by the Agent. Submit to DNA analysis.

records.addlTxt: 10:45 AM Defendant Michael David Skwortz in court.  Attorney Matthew Edward Weil in court for Michael David Skwortz.  Prosecuting attorney Benjamin Lindsay in court for the State of Wisconsin.

10:58 AM Prosecuting attorney Benjamin Lindsay appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael David Skwortz in court.  Attorney Matthew Edward Weil in court for Michael David Skwortz. Counsel requests adjournment of sentencing for Defendant to complete medical procedure. Counsel previously efiled plea questionnaire. Court examines Defendant, accepts change of plea to guilty, and finds Defendant guilty on Counts 1 and 2. Counts 3-6 dismissed and read in. State will recommend at sentencing: S/W 3 years probation w/conditions - No contact with RS or SS, counseling or treatment as recommended by the Agent, 40 days condition time. Defendant reminded that all bail conditions remain in effect until reporting to serve jail sentence.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
